name: marquee
description: Stay organized with minimal context switching, all inside your VS Code.
author: Sebastian Tiedtke <sebastian@stateful.com>

marquee.configuration.proxy.markdownDescription: URL to proxy (e.g. `https://username:password@domain.tld:port`). __Note:__ This only has an effect on widgets that gather data from the extension host (e.g. Welcome Widget).

marquee.configuration.fontSize.markdownDescription: Font Size of Widgets (`0` very small / `10` very large)

marquee.configuration.colorScheme.description: The color scheme applied to the Marquee Webview (default is based on the current VSCode color scheme)

marquee.configuration.name.markdownDescription: Your name so Marquee can greet you!

marquee.configuration.background.markdownDescription: Homescreen background image (currently only numbers between 1-10 are available, we will add support for Unsplash images soon).

marquee.configuration.modes.markdownDescription: Configuration of your widget location and display

marquee.configuration.launchOnStartup.markdownDescription: Open Marquee when VS Code starts up

marquee.widgets.projects.openProjectInNe.markdownDescription: If true, Marquee will open a project in a new window

marquee.widgets.github.language.markdownDescription: Query GitHub trends for a specific programming language

marquee.widgets.github.spoken.markdownDescription: Query GitHub trends for a specific spoken language

marquee.widgets.github.since.markdownDescription: Query GitHub trends by specific time period

marquee.widgets.github.trendFilter.markdownDescription: Query GitHub trends by specific key word

marquee.widgets.weather.city.markdownDescription: City for which the widget displays the weather forecast

marquee.widgets.weather.scale.markdownDescription: Scale to display the weather forecast in

marquee.widgets.todo.todoFilter.markdownDescription: Filter ToDos or their associated tags

marquee.widgets.todo.autoDetect.markdownDescription: Auto-detect ToDos in your code to allow adding them to Marquee
